title: Chelsea star posts throwback to first Stamford Bridge visit as a kid, but do you recognise him?
text:
A heartwarming series of photos have emerged of a current Chelsea player visiting Stamford Bridge as a seven-year-old... £58million man Christian Pulisic!

In a video for The Player's Tribune, the American winger revealed how he clearly remembers his visit to south-west London, admitting it was amazing how his life had come 'full circle.'

The 21-year-old, who signed from Borussia Dortmund, is yet to make a significant impact under Frank Lampard, but did assist Michy Batshuayi's winner against Ajax in midweek.

A seven-year-old Christian Pulisic sitting in the press conference room at Stamford Bridge

Pulisic in the changing rooms with John Terry and Frank Lampard shirts in the background

It’s crazy to think that I would end up coming to play for the first team of a club that I trained at as a young kid - check out my first few days in London 🔵⚪ #BecomingTheFranchise @PlayersTribune https://t.co/oekOy6Fg0w #ad pic.twitter.com/rD71LJED0F — Christian Pulisic (@cpulisic_10) October 24, 2019

In the video, Pulisic said of his visit to Stamford Bridge: 'The craziest thing is I remember going to Chelsea.

'I was very young, I was just going there to train with the youth Chelsea team and I remember being at the training ground, which I then a few weeks ago go back and see.

'I see the same thing and I'm like wow, it's crazy how full circle it came.'

His visit, on February 17 2006, took place during Jose Mourinho's second season at the club, when Chelsea defended their Premier League title.

Pulisic spoke about his experience at Stamford Bridge as a youngster with The Players' Tribune

Pulisic was in the UK due to his mother, Kelley, being on a one-year teaching exchange, and it was here where the American fell in love with the game.

He appeared for Brackley Town Under-8s, and never looked back, training with US Soccer development academy club PA Classics, before Dortmund signed him as a 16-year-old in February 2015.

Pulisic made his competitive debut for Chelsea at home against Leicester, in a 1-1 draw on August 18.
description: A member of the current Chelsea first-team squad actually visited Stamford Bridge as a seven-year-old, during Jose Mourinho's second year, when they defended their Premier League title.
